subject: Communication
title: Personal Space: The Invisible Bubble
description: One-minute skill: Personal Space: The Invisible Bubble.

hook.text: A Latin American stands close to talk. The Nordic backs away.

buildup.text: Edward T. Hall defined four distance zones: intimate (0-18in), personal (18in-4ft), social (4-12ft), and public (12ft+).

discovery.text: These zones vary dramatically by culture. Arab and Latin cultures use closer distances; Northern European and East.

twist.text: Violating someone's space zone triggers discomfort they can't explain. They just feel 'something's off' about you.

climax.text: Space norms are learned so early that adults can't articulate them. They're among the most invisible cultural rules.

punchline.text: The distance between you and another person speaks louder than words.

quiz.question: Who defined the four distance zones of proxemics?
